intro: Sartidia angolensis, commonly known as the Angola sartidia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in shrubland and forest edges, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often in shades of white or pale pink. Sartidia angolensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
